alert.note: Alert for Central Willamette Valley; Coast Range of Northwest Oregon; Greater Portland Metro Area (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 9:54PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WESTERN CLACKAMAS...NORTHEASTERN YAMHILL...NORTHWESTERN MARION AND SOUTHERN WASHINGTON COUNTIES THROUGH 1030 PM PDT... At 953 PM PDT, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm near Hillsboro, moving northwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Hillsboro, Beaverton, Tigard, Tualatin, Newberg, Forest Grove, Banks, Sherwood, Cornelius, King City, North Plains, Durham, Gaston, Cherry Grove, Dilley, Aloha, Farmington, and Scholls. This includes the following highways in Oregon... U.S. Highway 26 west of Portland between mile markers 50 and 57. State Highway 6 between mile markers 47 and 51. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Willamette Valley; Coast Range of Northwest Oregon; Greater Portland Metro Area
